intro: Galium × pseudoboreale, commonly known as the northern bedstraw, is a hybrid shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium × pseudoboreale is known for its fragrant foliage and is often found in the northern regions of North America.
